Type.Name: Gravity

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Gravity extends System.Enum

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Defines the reference point of a window and the meaning of coordinates passed to .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity Center = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the center of the window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity East = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the middle of the right edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity North = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The reference point is in the middle of the top edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity NorthEast = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the top right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity NorthWest = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the top left corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity South = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the middle of the lower edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity SouthEast = int32(9)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the lower right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity SouthWest = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the lower left corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity Static = int32(10)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the top left corner of the window itself, ignoring window manager decorations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.Gravity West = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The reference point is at the middle of the left edge.
